short_summary: This contract is for the Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) to provide Elder Helper services to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders. The Elder Helper must be available to assist and supplement the work of Elders, to enhance Indigenous programming. CSC is legislated to provide Indigenous offenders with the opportunity to further develop their understanding of traditional Indigenous spirituality while allowing non-Indigenous offenders to practice their beliefs and values systems.
description: Elder Helper Services for Indigenous Offenders
tags: CSC sulphur surgical differ Ideas sorry arts class crafting internal screenings!

Advanced contract award notice (ACAN) to provide Elder helper services to Indigenous offenders.  Services include analysing daily activity logs; writing, verbal and written reports; conducting group discussions, ceremony; performing traditional ceremonies in the absence of the elder; and maintaining the showroom for Indigenous offerings.

full_summary:
**Elder Helper Services**
Government of Canada - Correctional Service of Canada
**Public Notice**
Advanced Contract Award Notice (ACAN)

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) intends to award a contract for Elder Helper services to support Indigenous offenders in federal institutions. The contract requires the provision of Elder programming to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders and to enhance their understanding of traditional Indigenous spirituality.

**Objective:**
The program aims to provide cultural support and accommodation for Indigenous offenders, as per the Canadian Correctional and Conditional Release Act and individual correctional plans. The elder helper will assist in supporting Indigenous offenders on their traditional healing journey, conduct group discussions, and perform traditional ceremonies.

**Scope of Work:**

* Assisting Indigenous offenders in federal institutions to benefit from traditional healing and contemporary treatment interventions.
* Supporting the work of Elders and the interdisciplinary team.
* Coordinating and supervising offenders during traditional ceremonies.
* Conducting group discussions and teachings.
* Providing counseling services to offenders when Elders are unavailable.
* Assisting staff in preparing reports and providing technical support for case management and parole processes.

**Requirements:**

* Bilingual (English & French) services
* Two-year cumulative experience in assisting and supporting an Elder
* Two-year cumulative experience in providing counseling and guidance according to traditions and teachings
* Two-year cumulative experience in conducting group discussions

**Contract Award:**

* The contract is awarded to two pre-identified suppliers: Braiden Arcand and Douglas Tizya.
* The contract period is one year, from May 1, 2023, to April 30, 2024.
* The estimated cost of the contract is $56,025.86 (GST/HST extra) per supplier.

**Submission of Statement of Capabilities:**

* Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the services described in the ACAN may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the contact person identified in this notice on or before February 23, 2023, at 2:00 PM CST.

**Contact:**

* Janet Nelson, Regional Procurement Officer
* 3427 Faithfull Avenue
* Saskatoon, SK S7K 8H6
* (306) 659-9300
* janet.nelson@csc-scc.gc.ca

This contract is subject to the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB). Only suppliers who meet the definition of an Indigenous business can submit a statement of capabilities. Exclusions and/or limited tendering reasons are invoked
